short_description: The function is used to cluster timeseries.
long_description: The function is used to cluster timeseries using scalable unsupervised shapelet algorithm.

argument_clauses.name: Domain
argument_clauses.rDescription: The address of the Queen. The host parameter is the Aster Database Queen’s IP address or hostname.
argument_clauses.description: The address of the Queen. The host parameter is the Aster Database Queen’s IP address or hostname.

argument_clauses.name: Database
argument_clauses.rDescription: The name of the database where the input table is located.
argument_clauses.description: The name of the database where the input table is located.

argument_clauses.name: UserId
argument_clauses.rDescription: The Aster Database user name of the user running this function.
argument_clauses.description: The Aster Database user name of the user running this function.

argument_clauses.name: Password
argument_clauses.rDescription: The Aster Database password of the user.
argument_clauses.description: The Aster Database password of the user.

argument_clauses.name: SSLSettings
argument_clauses.rDescription: A string that includes all the SSL settings, except the password for the truststore.
argument_clauses.description: A string that includes all the SSL settings, except the password for the truststore.

argument_clauses.name: SSLTrustStorePassword
argument_clauses.rDescription: The password for the SSL truststore.
argument_clauses.description: The password for the SSL truststore.

argument_clauses.name: InputTable
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the name of the table that contains the input data.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the name of the table that contains the input data.

argument_clauses.name: OutputTable
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the name for the output table that the function creates. The default name is output_table.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the name for the output table that the function creates. The default name is output_table.

argument_clauses.name: ID
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the name of the input table column that contains the unique identity of a time series.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the name of the input table column that contains the unique identity of a time series.

argument_clauses.name: TimeColumn
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the name of the input table column that contains the time series.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the name of the input table column that contains the time series.

argument_clauses.name: ValueColumn
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the name of the input table column that contains the data point values.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the name of the input table column that contains the data point values.

argument_clauses.name: SAXWindowSize
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the ta.sax2 argument sax.window.size, which specifies the size of the sliding window. The window_size must be an INTEGER in the range [1, 1000000].
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the SAX2 argument WindowSize, which specifies the size of the sliding window. The window_size must be an INTEGER in the range [1, 1000000].

argument_clauses.name: SAXOutputFrequency
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the ta.sax2 argument sax.output.frequency, which specifies the number of data points to skip between successive sliding windows. The gap_between_windows must be an integer in the range [1, 1000]. The default value is 1. A smaller value increases accuracy (the chance of distinguishing time series from each other) at the cost of higher execution time.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the SAX2 argument OutputFrequency, which specifies the number of data points to skip between successive sliding windows. The gap_between_windows must be an integer in the range [1, 1000]. The default value is 1. A smaller value increases accuracy (the chance of distinguishing time series from each other) at the cost of higher execution time.

argument_clauses.name: RandomProjections
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the number of iterations required for random masking of ta.sax words during u_shapelets selection. The projections must be an INTEGER in the range [1, 30]. The default value is 10. Specifying a greater projections for a longer input time series increases the probability of identifying better u_shapelets at the cost of higher execution time.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the number of iterations required for random masking of SAX words during u_shapelets selection. The projections must be an INTEGER in the range [1, 30]. The default value is 10. Specifying a greater projections for a longer input time series increases the probability of identifying better u_shapelets at the cost of higher execution time.

argument_clauses.name: SaxSymbolsPerWindow
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the ta.sax2 argument sax.symbols.perwindow, which specifies the number of ta.sax code symbols to generate from a window. The symbols_per_window must an INTEGER in the range [1, 1000000]. If symbols_per_window is greater than window_size, the function changes symbols_per_window to window_size. By default, symbols_per_window is the same as window_size
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the SAX2 argument SymbolsPerWindow, which specifies the number of SAX code symbols to generate from a window. The symbols_per_window must an INTEGER in the range [1, 1000000]. If symbols_per_window is greater than window_size, the function changes symbols_per_window to window_size. By default, symbols_per_window is the same as window_size

argument_clauses.name: OverwriteOutput
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies whether to overwrite output_table, if it exists. The default value is 'false'.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies whether to overwrite output_table, if it exists. The default value is 'false'.

argument_clauses.name: Threshold
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the value at which an iteration stops and the function stops. The iteration i ends when scorei / scorei-1 is less than threshold. The threshold must be a DOUBLE PRECISION value in the range (0, 1). The default value is 0.5.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the value at which an iteration stops and the function stops. The iteration i ends when scorei / scorei-1 is less than threshold. The threshold must be a DOUBLE PRECISION value in the range (0, 1). The default value is 0.5.

argument_clauses.name: MaxNumIter
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the number of iterations at which the function stops. The max_iterations must be an INTEGER in the range [1, 50]. The default value is 10.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the number of iterations at which the function stops. The max_iterations must be an INTEGER in the range [1, 50]. The default value is 10.

argument_clauses.name: ShapeletCutOff
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the percentage of u-shapelets to use. The cut_off must be a DOUBLE PRECISION value in the range (0, 1]. The default value is 0.1 (10%).
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the percentage of u-shapelets to use. The cut_off must be a DOUBLE PRECISION value in the range (0, 1]. The default value is 0.1 (10%).
